column4: Point Value (Enter 1 for points, or leave blank for zero points and/or not grading the item)
column5: Form Guidance (information for checklist builder)

General Form Guidance:  This form gives guidance on checklist building for automated grading by giving suggested items within subsections.  Note that not all subsections would be used for all learners or learner levels. Not entering an item means that item will not be graded. Not entering a point value means it will not get a point assigned if the item is found.
Novice learners may be asked to gather and document the chief complaint in their note.  This should be case specific so that they document the correct chief complaint.

column2: Name - Any Male or Female Name
column5: Any name will be given credit.

column2: Patient Age or Date of Birth
column5: Novice learners or learning settings with age not provided (initial triage nurse), the learners may be asked to gather and document the age or date of birth in their note.
The word male or female will get credit if this item is graded.
If learners are to gather gender identification, this could be graded. Case specific grading requires the gender identification to be noted in the item.

column2: History of Present Illness (HPI) Section [OLDCARTS is here]

column5: When were symptoms first noticed?
Did the symptoms begin rapidly or slowly?
How long have you had the symptoms?
How long do episodes of pain last?
Is there a pattern of the timing of the pain (day/night, situational timing)?
Where on the body is your pain or describe where you are feeling the symptom?
Does the pain move anywhere else or radiate from one spot to another?

Describe the nature of the pain or symptom  i.e. sharp, burning, throbbing, dull, aching, pressure, stabbing, tingling    
Also consider other descriptors patients might use, "like a vise" or "someone sitting on my chest" or "winded like I exercised but I didn't"
Also consider "similar nature to my prior symptoms" or "different than prior symptoms"
How severe is you pain? How does this compare to past episodes?

column3: it was an 8 on a scale of 1 to 10
column5: How severe is the pain on a scale of 0-10?
Are there activities (eating, exercise, standing, etc.) that make the symptom worse?  Have you noticed things that trigger the symptoms?
Have you found something that relieves the symptoms (medication, position, eating, etc.)?
Any relevant infectious or occuptional exposures? (e.g. covid illness in sibling, asbestos exposure)
Consider the learning objectives and relevance of such topics.
Items like past episodes of the symptom, visits for this, past treatment response
Active diagnoses with or without treatment
Hospitalizations and old or remote illnesses
Medication names (if faculty note the generic and trade names credit will be given for either, likewise credit will be given for acceptable abbreviations listed)
Medication route, frequency
Documentation of medication adherence

If allergy item gives both trade and generic then either noted by the learner would count.  If the item notes what the reactions is, then that would be needed be needed for credit e.g. erythromycin causes hives.  If the reaction type is not noted, it will not be graded.
If the reaction type is not noted, it will not be graded.

column2: PMH: Recovery or Abstinence from any substances or alcohol
column3: heavy alcohol use (two 750 mL bottles of spirits per week), recently quit drinking 1 week ago
column5: For capture of prior addiction treatment, recovery status
Specific and separate headings for past surgical history, abbrevations count, option to make each surgery noted an item, or simply capture a list.
Only use if relevant to case learning objectives.

column3: mom died of brain cancer, dad died of effects of alcoholism
column5: Items that are relevant to an active CC-HPI combination.  e.g. FH of heart disease in a chest pain patient
Items that are relevant to any wellness or preventive visit.  This would include genetic diseases, risks for cancer, prior occupational exposures, etc.
Use only those sections relevant to learning or testing objectives

column3: heavy alcohol use for 40 years suddenly stopped
column5: Use if current alcohol use is relevant to the case.
Use if housing security discussion is relevant to the case
Use of food security discussion is relevant to the case
Use if physical security (risk of interpersonal violence) is relevant to the case
Use if financial security is relevant to the case e.g. ability to afford medications
Use for things like past vaccinations, screening for infecitous risk
Use for things like past cologard, colonoscopy, other
Use for things like past PSA levels or physical examinations
Use for self exam history or professional exams
Use for things like mammograms, follow up studies after mammograms
Use for PAP history of having and results
Use for things like condom use, partner history, exposure history, HIV PREP
Use if referring to past or current exercise patterns.  Planning goes in treatment plan.
Use in regards to diet content rather than food security covered in social history.  e.g. caffeine, processed foods, calorie intake
ROS items should be relevant and case specific.  Good place to have pertinent negatives as items.

column2: ROS: Head and Neck (includes Ear, Nose, Throat)

column5: Suggest items that are important to the case including those that would yield pertinent positives or pertinent negatives.
Enter the specific temperature and units of F or C
Enter the specific HR
Enter the specific RR
Enter the specific BP in format systolic number/diastoic number
Enter the specific Pox % value
Enter the height in the same units that will be used on site. (english or metric)
Enter the weight in the same units that will be used on site. (english or metric)
Item should ask for specific terms such as "cachectic, high BMI, mobile or immobile, etc."

column3: Tissue texture abnormaility and tenderness mid thoracic spine
column5: details on spine level, muscle character, tissue abnormality, symmetry or asymmetry, restriction of motion, tenderness (TAART findings)

column2: Assessment, New Active Problems, Differential Diagnoses
column5: Include an osteopathic diagnosis as appropriate.
Most likely or actual diagnosis should be listed first, with ideally descending order of likelihood.
DDx justification items may or may not be used.  Example: for PE history of long plane trip might be used to justify putting PE on the DDx.  Leave justification sections blank if not using.

column2: Work Up aka Evaluation Plan aka Diagnostic Evaluation Plan
column5: Items might include: laboratory studies, radiologic studies, specialty consultation

column3: Sodium and other electolytes, or BMP or CMP
consider liver enzymes due to alcohol abuse

column5: Items might include referrals to various therapies (PT, OT, psychology), pharmacologic and not pharmacologic treatment suggestions

column3: consider benzodiazepine or gabapentin or carbamezepine

column5: Specific timing is ideal along with clarity on return to primary care or follow up with specialty care.
Patient education or counseling on any case related topic could be come an item (alcohol risks, tobacco risks, cannabis risks, general pregnancy, wound care, etc.)

column3: effects of alcohol withdrawal on seizures

column5: Humanistic concerns includes how things like social influences on health may impact their health or illness states, but is not limited to SDOH
